phrase.cizu_name: be (或 get) lost in the shuffle

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)be overlooked or missed in a confused or crowded situation
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美， 非正式)在混乱中被忽略（或遗漏）

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: perhaps from Low German schuffeln 'walk clumsily', also 'deal dishonestly, shuffle (cards'), of Germanic origin; related to shove and scuffle

entry.def: If you shuffle somewhere, you walk there without lifting your feet properly off the ground.

example.tran: 莫伊拉拖着脚穿过厨房。
他们有些不情愿地拖着脚走着。

entry.tran: (通常因不舒服或难为情)挪动双脚，坐立不安
entry.def: If you shuffle around, you move your feet about while standing or you move your bottom about while sitting, often because you feel uncomfortable or embarrassed.

example.ex: He shuffles around in his chair...
He grinned and shuffled his feet.
example.tran: 他咧嘴笑了，脚动来动去。

entry.def: If you shuffle playing cards, you mix them up before you begin a game.

example.ex: There are various ways of shuffling and dealing the cards.
example.tran: 有各种不同的洗牌和发牌方式。

entry.tran: 将(纸张等)变换位置;打乱…的次序
entry.def: If you shuffle things such as pieces of paper, you move them around so that they are in a different order.

example.ex: The silence lengthened as Thorne unnecessarily shuffled some papers.
example.tran: 索恩整理着一些本无须整理的文件，沉默还在延续。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of mixing cards haphazardly
2. walking with a slow dragging motion without lifting your feet;

sentences.sentence: "from his shambling I assumed he was very old"
"We heard his feet shuffling down the hall"

means.word_mean: 2. move about, move back and forth;

sentences.sentence: "He shuffled his funds among different accounts in various countries so as to avoid the IRS"

means.word_mean: 3. mix so as to make a random order or arrangement;

auth_sentence.content: He crossed the floor...with an old man's shuffle.
auth_sentence.res_content: He crossed the floor...with an old man's shuffle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He crossed the floor...with an old man's shuffle.

auth_sentence.content: Norma had disheveled shoulder-length hair and a stiff shuffle.
auth_sentence.res_content: Norma had disheveled shoulder-length hair and a stiff shuffle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Norma had disheveled shoulder-length hair and a stiff shuffle.

auth_sentence.content: "That's now the Nicki Shuffle," she said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "That's now the Nicki Shuffle," she said.

sentences.en: I wish you’d remember to shuffle before you deal.
sentences.cn: 我希望在你发牌前记得洗牌。

sentences.en: They believe that when they shuffle off this mortal coil their souls will become stars.
sentences.cn: 他们相信一旦脱离了尘世的喧闹与烦扰，他们的灵魂就会化作星辰。
